snippet: The police are still unraveling the mystery surrounding the girl whose body was found in a cooler in Manhattan, and they did not release her name or that of her relatives.
abstract: New York City police are still unraveling mystery surrounding Baby Hope, little girl whose emaciated and bound body was found in a cooler in Upper Manhattan in 1991; recent publicity about the cold case brought tip from area resident that led detectives to woman whose DNA showed her to be victim's mother; officials have not yet released name of Baby Hope or her relatives, and say that mother is not considered a suspect.

byline.original: By JAMES BARRON and JOSEPH GOLDSTEIN
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Al Baker, J. David Goodman, Winnie Hu, William K. Rashbaum and Marc Santora.

lead_paragraph: The police are still unraveling the mystery surrounding the girl whose body was found in a cooler in Manhattan, and they did not release her name or that of her relatives.

headline.main: Dead 22 Years, ‘Baby Hope’ Has a Name Again
headline.print_headline: Dead 22 Years, ‘Baby Hope’ Has a Name
